title: Tito Ceccherini
text:
Tito Ceccherini (born 1973) is an Italian conductor with a focus on <a href="opera">opera</a>, especially contemporary opera. He has performed at major opera houses in Europe, leading several world premieres. 
Career.
Ceccherini was born in <a href="Milan">Milan</a> and studied in his hometown.
He conducted world premieres, including Sciarrino's "<a href="Da%20gelo%20a%20gelo">Da gelo a gelo</a>" at the <a href="Schwetzingen%20Festival">Schwetzingen Festival</a> in 2006, <a href="Philippe%20F%C3%A9nelon">Philippe Fénelon</a>'s "La Cerisaie" at the <a href="Bolshoi%20Theatre">Bolshoi Theatre</a> in Moscow in 2010, and Sciarrino's "Superflumina" at the <a href="Nationaltheater%20Mannheim">Nationaltheater Mannheim</a> in 2011.
At the <a href="Oper%20Frankfurt">Oper Frankfurt</a>, he conducted Janáček's "<a href="From%20the%20House%20of%20the%20Dead">Aus einem Totenhaus</a>", Stravinsky's "<a href="The%20Rake%E2%80%99s%20Progress">The Rake’s Progress</a>", Bellini's "<a href="I%20puritani">I puritani</a>" and the world premiere of Lucia Ronchetti's "<a href="Inferno%20%28opera%29">Inferno</a>" in 2021.
